title: Ivanka Trump makes another embarrassing Instagram spelling fail
text:

Donald Trump's daughter, Ivanka, made an embarrassing Instagram spelling mistake while congratulating a Nobel Peace Prize winner.

The 37-year-old took to social media to congratulate the Prime Minister of Ethiopia - who has been awarded a Nobel Peace Prize for his efforts to achieve peace with Eritrea.

However, in her gesture of goodwill, Ivanka misspelled Nobel, instead writing 'Noble'.

She captioned her image: "Congratulations Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed on being awarded the Noble Peace Prize for your work on peace and reconciliation with your neighbour Eritrea!"

The award is actually named after its founder Alfred Nobel, a Swedish businessman, chemist, engineer, inventor and philanthropist.

(Image: ivankatrump/Instagram)

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

Her post was made even more awkward by the fact Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed was unlikely to even directly see it - as he doesn't follow her on Instagram , reports the Express .

Social media users were quick to notice.

One said: “She congratulated Minister Ahmed on the “NOBLE” peace prize. Are all Trumps just plain stupid?”

Another added: “Ivanka just congratulated the "noble! peace prize" winner on her Instagram account which he doesn't follow.”

It's not the first time Ivanka has taken to Instagram and shared an image captioned with a spelling mistake to her 5.2 million followers.

(Image: Getty Images)

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

Just weeks ago, she congratulated Boris Johnson on becoming Prime Minister - spelling the United Kingdom as "United Kingston".

She wrote: "Congratulations Boris Johnson on becoming the next Prime Minister of the United Kingston.”

Again, Instagram users didn't hold back when it came to pointing out her error.

One particularly savage response read: "I’m 14 and can spell better than you."
description: The 37-year-old took to social media to congratulate the Prime Minister of Ethiopia - who has been awarded a Nobel Peace Prize for his efforts to achieve peace with Eritrea - spelling one crucial word wrong
